feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for New Zealand issued by MetService

entry.title: Strong Wind Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Severe gale westerlies gusting 120km/h in exposed places. Note: Another burst of strong winds is expected early Sunday morning. An additional Warning or Watch may be issued for this area after the winds in this Warning have eased. Impact: Damage to trees, powerlines, and unsecured structures possible. Driving may be difficult, especially for high-sided vehicles and motorcycles. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal. Changes: Area south of Hastings upgraded to an Orange Warning.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Severe gale west to southwest winds gusting 120 km/h in exposed places. Impact: Damage to trees, powerlines, and unsecured structures possible. Driving may be difficult, especially for high-sided vehicles and motorcycles. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low. Changes: Watch upgraded to an Orange Warning.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Watch
entry.summary: West to southwest winds may approach severe gale in exposed places. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate. Changes: Watch period extended.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Watch
entry.summary: Westerly winds may approach severe gale in exposed places. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate. Changes: Area south of Hastings upgraded to an Orange Warning.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Watch
entry.summary: West to southwest winds may approach severe gale in exposed places. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Watch
entry.summary: Southwest winds may approach severe gale in exposed places. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Showers falling as snow to 700 metres from early Saturday morning until around midday Saturday and 3 to 5 cm may accumulate about the summit and lesser amounts further down.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Snow showers are expected to affect the road above 700 metres on Saturday. 1 to 3 cm may accumulate about the summit with lesser amounts lower down.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Showers with a passing front early Saturday morning may briefly fall as snow at the summit of the pass. Up to 1 cm may accumulate on the road.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Showers falling as snow to 800 metres from early Saturday morning and 2 to 5 cm may accumulate about the summit and lesser amounts further down.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Showers falling as snow to 700 metres from early Saturday morning. About 2 to 4 cm may accumulate about the summit in the morning and lesser amounts lower down. Snow flurries may continue during Saturday afternoon, but little if any snow is expected to settle.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: From midnight, snow is expected to lower to 500 metres. 10 to 15 cm may accumulate about the tunnel Saturday morning with lesser amounts lower down. Snow showers may continue Saturday afternoon but little if any snow is expected to settle.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited
